newsitem.title: LEBANON: Four pro-Israeli militiamen wounded in Lebanon.
newsitem.headline: Four pro-Israeli militiamen wounded in Lebanon.

text.p: Four pro-Israeli militiamen were wounded on Wednesday when guerrillas set off a road side bomb near their patrol in south Lebanon, pro-Israeli militia sources said.
They said the blast occurred when the South Lebanon Army patrol passed on the road leading to the outpost of Qantara in the central sector of Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone.

No group claimed immediate responsibility for the attack which brought to 14 the number of SLA militiamen wounded in guerrilla attacks since the beginning of the year. Two SLA fighters were killed in similar attacks.
The pro-Iranian Hizbollah is fighting Israeli troops and their local militia allies in a bid to oust them from the 15-km (nine miles)-wide occupation zone.
